places_with_reviews.name: Maa Bhadrakali Mandir(oldest kali temple)
places_with_reviews.address: Bhadrakali sahi, Aharapada, 2G8P+3MX, Haripur, Odisha 756128, India

reviews.text: The Goddess on who's name the place Bhadrak is named. The temple is located in interior village of Haripur and it is 10kms from Bhadrak town.

Beautiful temple of Goddess Bhadrakali. The place is named Bhadrak from this. Just about 8-10 km from the city, but both the roads are clumsy and crowded. The serpentine roads warrant careful & slow driving, hence taking much more time to travel. Ample parking space is there.
The temple is good but lacks basic amenities like a toilet and drinking water. The road to the temple is narrow and needs expansion.

●This is the temple of Maa Bhadrakali,based on whose name City Bhadrak is named.

●This temple is very beautiful and old architecture of Bhadrak .

●It is a very peaceful and pious place.

●Devotees from different places visit this temple to pray to Maa Bhadrakali to get her blessings.

●This temple has also others God's temple inside like Mahapravu Jagannath,Pravu Balabhadra,Maa Subhadra and Mahadev Shiv ji Temple.

●The walls inside the  temple also bears paintings of  various  of Besha of  Mahapravu Jagannath,Pravu Balabhadra and Maa Subhadra and SAPTAMATRUKA  BESHA of Maa Bhadrakali.

●This temple also has idols of NABAGRAHA and DASHA MAHAVIDYA.

I would like to suggest that every person must visit Maa Bhadrakali Temple. Her blessings will always keep you happy in your life.

Jay Maa Bhadrakali🙏 the "Aradhya Devi" of local people of Bhadrak District hence the name Bhadrak. This temple has a huge premise where you will find some other temples such as Jagannath Temple and Shiv temple. A large part of the temple is dedicated for Hawan purposes. Beautiful architecture & separate space for male and female worshippers. Neat and well maintained by the staffs. Huge parking space is available right in front of the temple.

places_with_reviews.name: Jagannath Temple(ଜଗନ୍ନାଥ ମନ୍ଦିର)

reviews.text:
Shri Jagannath Temple Established 1985...

Actually, the main diety (mool sthanam) is Lord Shiva goes by the name of Baba Bhadreshwar and Maa Banadurga Devi (Maa Durga) but not sure why being called as Jagannath Temple...

I missed to asked about to the priest over there...

May be next time you visit, you can ask but overall this place gives you so much shanti, relaxation to heart and mind...

Must pay visit here...
Jay Baba Bholenath🙏
Jay Jagannath 🙏

Beautiful and old temple in the Bhadrak main city located on the Salandi Bypass road towards Tihidi. Dedicated to Lord Jagannath, Balabhadra, Subhadra & Sudarshan in one premise, Lord Bhadreswara in another and Goddess Baghuasuni in the last.

The temple is well maintained. Apt for various functions like weddings, Upanayan, etc. are done in a systematic way. Separate rooms and Mandap are available for such activities. Required documents are verified for weddings.

Anna prasad is available for eating as well as take away. In ₹60, you can have good quality Rice, Dal, two types of curry ( I had sajanaa chhuin, alu, baigana, badi besara and buta alu tarkari on 22.02.2022), a khataa and Kheer. One can have as much as he/she likes. Payment through UPI is also available.
Good temple. Prasad available on all days. Gets really crowded on the days when there are weddings.

This is very imazing place, the atmosphere of their is very cool and quite...
The flower garden is so Beautiful 😍
Jai Jagannath ❤️

Good peaceful place. Also very clean.
Some development work is going on May become even more better.
Have a function hall inside the premise for marriage, Pooja and functions.
